locacionSeccion.parrafo:
Ecuador is one of the most biodiverse places on the planet with landscapes ranging from the highlands to the tropical forest. The Andes, the Amazon and the Galapagos Islands are all part of Ecuador.
These diverse locations are all very close to each other and have excellent and constant climate conditions, throughout the year. Ecuador has a very rich and varied architecture, reminiscent of different and past eras.
There are 21 operational airports in the country, 3 of them, international.

aboutEcuador.title: Cultural and Historical Richness
aboutEcuador.text: Ecuador’s colonial cities, such as Quito and Cuenca (both UNESCO World Heritage Sites), along with its vibrant indigenous traditions, provide authentic and visually stunning backdrops for any production.

aboutEcuador.title: Diverse Locations in a Compact Territory
aboutEcuador.text: From the Andes Mountains and the Amazon Rainforest to the Pacific Coast and the iconic Galapagos Islands, Ecuador offers an incredible variety of landscapes within a relatively small area. This allows productions to shoot multiple scenes without the need for extensive travel.

aboutEcuador.title: Growing Film Industry Infrastructure
aboutEcuador.text: Ecuador’s film industry is rapidly developing, with local crews, equipment rentals, and post-production facilities available to support international projects.

aboutEcuador.title: Government Incentives and Support
aboutEcuador.text: Ecuador offers attractive incentives for international productions, including tax exemptions, streamlined permits, and logistical support through institutions like the Ecuador Film Commission.

aboutEcuador.title: Warm and Welcoming Culture
aboutEcuador.text: Ecuadorians are known for their hospitality and willingness to collaborate, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable filming experience.
